thread.title: Congress slams ‘sabbatical’ rumors as Rahul Gandhi leaves for US
thread.title_full: Congress slams ‘sabbatical’ rumors as Rahul Gandhi leaves for US | The Financial Express

author: financialexpress.com
title: Congress slams ‘sabbatical’ rumors as Rahul Gandhi leaves for US
text:
Other Articles UN and New York, where leaders turn a blind eye to each other Students of Mahesh Kale School of Music to sing Indian, US anthems for PM Narendra Modi Muslims in Kerala celebrate Eid-ul-Zuha by offering early morning prayers The Congress on Tuesday announced that party vice president Rahul Gandhi is on a personal trip to Aspen, US to attend a conference and asserted that he will continue to lead the party’s Bihar campaign as also in the rest of the country.
Rahul Gandhi’s visit, interestingly coincides with Prime Minister Narendra Modi ’s, who will also be in the U.S from Thursday on a six-day visit.
“Congress Vice President, Rahul Gandhi is travelling to Aspen, U.S on a short visit to attend a conference. The conference is expected to be attended by global leaders from various domains, both from government and private sectors,” party spokesperson Randeep Surjewala said.
“We reject all rumors stating otherwise,” he added.
Rahul had earlier gone abroad on a 56-day ‘sabbatical’ when the budget session of Parliament had commenced, leading to rumors and speculation across political parties.
First Published on September 23, 2015 8:45 am
